title: Implement pulsing animation for in-progress tasks
description:
Implement task pulsing animation:

Animation cycle (4 frames at 1fps):
Frame 0: #FAB387 (peach)
Frame 1: #F9E2AF (yellow)
Frame 2: #FAB387 (peach)
Frame 3: #F38BA8 (red-ish)

Apply to:
1. In-progress task icon (●)
2. Current task marker (▶)
3. Running status indicator

Animation driver:
- tickMsg fires every 1 second
- Increment m.animFrame on each tick
- Use animFrame % 4 to select color
- tickCmd() returns tea.Tick(time.Second, func(t time.Time) tea.Msg { return tickMsg(t) })

Render function:
func pulsingStyle(animFrame int) lipgloss.Style {
    colors := []string{"#FAB387", "#F9E2AF", "#FAB387", "#F38BA8"}
    return lipgloss.NewStyle().Foreground(lipgloss.Color(colors[animFrame % 4]))
}

Only animate when m.running is true.
When paused, use static orange color.
closed_reason: Added pulsingStyle() function with 4-frame animation cycle (peach/yellow/peach/red at 1fps using animFrame%4). Updated renderTaskLine() to pulse in-progress task icons and current task cursor. Updated renderStatusBar() to pulse running indicator. Animation only triggers when m.running=true; paused shows static orange.
